common

Class AbstractByteReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractByteReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomAccessByteReader, SequentialByteReader

    public abstract class AbstractByteReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the functionality to perform reader operations intended for obtaining data from a byte array. Data can either be read sequentially or at random, depending on the implementing sub-classes.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AbstractByteReader(byte[] buf, int offset, java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String dumpRawBytes()
      Returns a formatted string representation of the raw buffer contents, primarily intended for debugging.
      int getBaseOffset()
      Retrieves the offset pointer to the byte array, where read operations can start from.
      java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
      Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
      int length()
      Returns the length of the readable portion of the byte array (buffer length minus baseOffset).
      byte peek(int offset)
      Retrieves the data at the specified offset within the byte array without advancing the position.
      byte[] peek(int offset, int length)
      Retrieves a sub-array of bytes at the specified offset without advancing the position.
      void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
      Sets the byte order for interpreting the input bytes correctly.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractByteReader

        public AbstractByteReader(byte[] buf,
                          int offset,
                          java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs an instance to store the specified byte array containing payload data and the byte order to interpret the input bytes correctly. The offset specifies the starting position within the array to read from.
        Parameters:
        buf - an array of bytes acting as the buffer
        offset - specifies the starting position within the specified array
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseOffset

        public int getBaseOffset()
        Retrieves the offset pointer to the byte array, where read operations can start from.
        Returns:
        the base offset

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Sets the byte order for interpreting the input bytes correctly.
        Parameters:
        order - the byte order for interpreting the input bytes

      • getByteOrder

        public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the byte order, indicating how data values will be interpreted correctly.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the readable portion of the byte array (buffer length minus baseOffset).
        Returns:
        the array length

      • peek

        public byte peek(int offset)
        Retrieves the data at the specified offset within the byte array without advancing the position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset (relative to baseOffset)
        Returns:
        the byte of data

      • peek

        public byte[] peek(int offset,
                   int length)
        Retrieves a sub-array of bytes at the specified offset without advancing the position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset (relative to baseOffset)
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array
        Returns:
        the sub-array of bytes

      • dumpRawBytes

        public java.lang.String dumpRawBytes()
        Returns a formatted string representation of the raw buffer contents, primarily intended for debugging.
        Returns:
        string containing a hex dump of the buffer
